item.title: U.S. to Press Ahead With EU Trade Deal Despite Opposition, Bessent Says
item.description: The Treasury Secretary said he expects to proceed with the agreement, despite some European Union lawmakers saying they might put it on hold over Trump’s Greenland comments.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: The $100 Billion of U.S. Goods at Risk of Tariffs in Trump’s Greenland Push
item.description: From Boeing aircraft to bourbon whiskey, the European Union has created a list of hundreds of categories of American products that it plans to target if trade talks unravel.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Katz

item.title: Greenland Rift Makes NATO Vulnerable to Russia, Says Senior German General
item.description: President Trump’s push to take control of the Arctic island is threatening the alliance’s cohesion, one of Germany’s highest ranking officers warned.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Israel Destroys Parts of U.N. Agency Headquarters in East Jerusalem
item.description: Israeli authorities began tearing down structures in the Jerusalem compound of Unrwa, escalating a battle between the government and the main agency tasked with providing assistance to Palestinian refugees.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Market Reaction to Greenland Tensions Has Been Muted, BOE’s Bailey Says
item.description: Bailey said markets were less volatile than might have been expected, but added policymakers must keep a close eye on developments.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Trump’s $1 Billion-a-Seat Diplomacy Club Takes Aim at the U.N.
item.description: Other major powers invited to join the Board of Peace have reacted cautiously so far.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Chinese Policymakers Look Focused on Domestic Demand to Lift Economy
item.description: Senior state planners are formulating a five-year plan to lift domestic demand, acknowledging that the world’s second-largest economy currently faces an imbalance between “strong supply and weak demand.”

item.title: Trump to Hold Meeting on Greenland in Davos
item.description: The president said he had agreed to the meeting at the World Economic Forum after a “very good” phone call with the secretary-general of NATO.
item.dc:creator: Gareth Vipers

item.title: Trump Threatens 200% Tariffs on French Wine to Push Macron Involvement in Gaza Board
item.description: The U.S. president also repeated his desire to control Greenland, saying Europe and Denmark couldn’t protect the Arctic territory.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Japan’s Long-Term Bond Yields Surge as Looming Election Triggers Fiscal Worries
item.description: Japan’s long-term government bond yields surged to multi-year highs Tuesday, spurred by fears that an upcoming election could lead to a consumption-tax rate cut that might worsen the country’s public finances.
item.dc:creator: Ronnie Harui

item.title: Iranian Protester Tells of an Uprising Violently Suppressed
item.description: President Trump, after pledging to punish the Iranian regime for killing protesters, backed away from military intervention last week.
item.dc:creator: David S. Cloud

item.title: Chevron’s Dilemma in Venezuela: Support Trump’s Vision Without Losing Money
item.description: The company lobbied hard for proximity to Venezuela’s oil wealth—but it has little appetite for making major investments there in the near term.
item.dc:creator: Emily Glazer

item.title: What a Break With Europe Means for the American Economy
item.description: Europe is the U.S.’s biggest trading partner, largest investor and closest financial ally.
item.dc:creator: Sam Goldfarb

item.title: Europe Contends With a Big New Threat: The U.S.
item.description: Most governments in Europe seek to de-escalate the confrontation and want to delay the day when they decouple the region’s security and economy from the U.S.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: Opinion | Why the Supreme Court Tariff Case Is Such a Big Deal
item.description: President Trump’s weekend spree shows how unlimited his claim of power is.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | China Hits the Economic Doldrums
item.description: Exports are booming, but the property bust is killing household wealth.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Hit Iran in Its Shadow Bank Accounts
item.description: Dubai-based financial institutions help Tehran escape sanctions. The U.S. has the means to stop it.
item.dc:creator: Michael Doran

item.title: Opinion | Notable & Quotable: Zionism and the New Right
item.description: ‘The nationalist right’s suspicion of Jewish influence and of Israel makes little sense within its own stated values.’

item.title: Opinion | Davos Men Create Hard Times
item.description: The comfortable postwar order gives way as old conflicts and demons return.
item.dc:creator: Walter Russell Mead

item.title: Opinion | With His Pen, Trump Can Save Cubans
item.description: A bureaucratic snafu leaves them in danger of deportation to the communist island.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Scott Shapiro

item.title: Trump Links Greenland Threats to Missing Out on Nobel Prize
item.description: European capitals are scrambling to de-escalate tensions over the island; Denmark sends more troops.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: Spanish Prime Minister Promises Answers After Train Collision Kills at Least 39
item.description: Dozens were injured in the crash involving two high-speed trains in southern Spain.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Can a U.S.-Greenland Partnership Work? Just Look at These Pacific Islands
item.description: U.S. agreements with three island nations have benefited both sides but have also had challenges.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Kidnapping and $12 Billion Battle Hang Over Conoco Return to Venezuela
item.description: President Trump is urging oil companies to dive back into Latin America, but for ConocoPhillips, “the bar’s likely higher.”
item.dc:creator: Benoît Morenne

item.title: China Reports Robust Economic Growth, Thanks to Resilient Exports
item.description: Momentum slowed recently, with last year’s economic performance underscoring how China’s growth has become increasingly lopsided.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: China’s Birthrate Sinks to Record Low
item.description: The number of births fell to the lowest level in decades, while the country’s population shrank for a fourth consecutive year.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: Pub Owners Turn Against Government in Britain’s Latest Rebellion
item.description: More than 1,000 pubs have banned Labour Party members over a plan to raise taxes. Even hairdressers are refusing service.
item.dc:creator: James Hookway

item.title: Europe Is Bracing for a New Trade Fight With Trump. Here Are Its Options.
item.description: From retaliatory tariffs to the never-before-used “bazooka,” European leaders have a slate to choose from in responding to U.S. threats over Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: Syrian President Forces Major Concessions From U.S.-Backed SDF in Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: Pro-government forces seize a military base, oil facilities and a dam on the Euphrates river before reaching a truce with the Kurdish-led militia.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: In Trump’s Drive for Greenland, NATO Is the First Casualty
item.description: The threat of a new trade war with Europe is pushing the trans-Atlantic alliance into its deepest crisis since World War II.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Israel Clashes With U.S. Over Turkey, Qatar Involvement in Gaza Oversight
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the White House efforts are “contrary to its policy,” a rare public admonishment.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: In Iran, Streets Full of Soldiers and Warnings From Loudspeakers
item.description: Protests are replaced by virtual martial law as the regime reasserts control following a deadly uprising aimed at ending its rule.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: Taiwan’s Flagship Chip Maker Charts a Future Beyond Taiwan
item.description: TSMC has for decades provided a “Silicon Shield” to its namesake island. Now it sees both business and geopolitical reasons for going big in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Amrith Ramkumar

item.title: Fed Turmoil Is Threatening Dollar Supremacy Just as China Pushes the Yuan
item.description: Economists see a politicized central bank damaging investor confidence in the U.S. system while Beijing advances in globalizing its currency.
item.dc:creator: Rory Jones

item.title: Germany’s Military Recruitment Drive Has a Gen Z Problem
item.description: In a shift from the 20th century’s postwar pacifism, today’s generational split over the military is more about economics than politics.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: U.S. Blockade Shuts Off China, Cuba From Venezuelan Oil
item.description: Only U.S.-bound tankers of crude have left the oil-exporting country since the arrest of Nicolás Maduro, a new report says.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Trump Says Iran Needs New Leaders
item.description: The comments came after Iran’s supreme leader called Trump a criminal and blamed him for deaths during the protests.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Xi’s Enforcers Punished Nearly a Million in 2025—and China’s Leader Wants More
item.description: Xi Jinping has ordered the Communist Party’s discipline inspectors to flex their powers even more forcefully and ensure his policies are executed as intended.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: The Tanker Tycoons and Oil Brokers Cashing In on the Venezuela Trade
item.description: Oil traders Vitol and Trafigura and Greek tanker owners are diving back into the country after Nicolás Maduro’s ouster.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Feng

item.title: Iranian Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei Is Running Out of Road
item.description: With his room for maneuver shrinking fast, he faces a climbdown on deeply held beliefs to bring relief to his country.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Delcy Rodríguez Goes From Pariah to the U.S. Pick to Lead Venezuela
item.description: President Trump has established a partnership with Maduro’s former vice president, who scraped her way to the top with a mix of guile and pragmatism.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: How Trump Went From ‘Locked and Loaded’ to Hitting Pause on Striking Iran
item.description: Senior U.S. military officials were prepared for a strike on Wednesday, but the president was advised it could lead to prolonged conflict in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: China and Canada Edge Closer With Progress on Trade
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s visit to Beijing yields agreement on a “strategic partnership,” as China seeks to court countries grappling with volatile U.S. trade policies.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Why Greenland Matters to U.S. Defense, in 7 Maps
item.description: While many Americans and Europeans say the U.S. doesn’t need to own Greenland to bolster security, the island does play a big role in naval and missile defense for North America and across the North Atlantic.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Canadian Leader Spurned by Trump Finds a Warm Embrace in China
item.description: Beijing is hosting Mark Carney as it works to sustain its exports and woo U.S. allies frustrated with American protectionism.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: ‘A Massacre Happened’: The 24 Hours That Bloodied Iran
item.description: Authorities shut down the internet on Jan. 8. Then the large-scale killings began.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: British American Tobacco to End South African Manufacturing
item.description: BAT South Africa said it would cease cigarette production in the country because of “the devastating impact of the illicit cigarette trade”.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stonor

item.title: China Imports to Help Lower U.K. Inflation to Target, BOE’s Taylor Says
item.description: The annual rate of inflation is likely to fall to the Bank of England’s 2% target by the middle of this year, aided by cheap imports from China, the rate-setter said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: The Obscure Bank Collapse That Sent Iran Into a Tailspin
item.description: Bad loans to regime cronies brought down Ayandeh Bank, accelerating a long-running financial crisis.
item.dc:creator: Jared Malsin

item.title: U.K. House Prices Expected to Rise But London Likely to Straggle
item.description: U.K. house prices are expected to rise in 2026, with Scotland and Northern England showing the strongest growth and sales prospects, according to real-estate website Zoopla.
item.dc:creator: Anthony O. Goriainoff

item.title: A Custody Battle Over Dogs Rocks an African Nation
item.description: Palace guard dogs are said to protect Malawi’s president from intruders and witchcraft. The outgoing leader decided to keep a few.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: South Africa Risks Angering Trump by Hosting Navies of Iran, Russia, China
item.description: The military exercises come at a time of already strained relations with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: U.S. Escalates Venezuela Oil Embargo With Two Tanker Seizures
item.description: American special forces boarded a vessel that had been pursued for two weeks, while the Coast Guard seized another tanker in waters off Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Russia Sends Submarine to Escort Tanker the U.S. Tried to Seize Off Venezuela
item.description: The move raises the stakes over the Trump administration’s attempt to seize the Bella 1, which officials say is part of fleet transporting illicit oil.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Israel Flexes New Diplomatic Muscle in Recognition of Somaliland
item.description: Two years of war have honed Israeli independence on the world stage.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Modi Taps India’s Consumer Power in Trade Fight With Trump
item.description: The efforts of India’s prime minister to juice consumer spending and bolster the economy are showing signs of success.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Russia Doubles Down on Allegations Ukraine Targeted Putin Residence
item.description: Officials are using the alleged attack as a pretext to threaten retaliation and a tougher stance in negotiations.

item.title: Ukraine Seeks Decadeslong Security Guarantee as Trump Offers 15 Years
item.description: Kyiv said the guarantee offered by the U.S. would be too short to deter Russia from future aggression.

item.title: Trump Says Talks to End Ukraine War Yield Progress Though Hurdles Remain
item.description: The U.S. president offers few specifics after a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin and a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to Immediate Cease-Fire in Border Clashes
item.description: At least 22 civilians—21 in Cambodia and one in Thailand—have been killed since an earlier truce collapsed on Dec. 8.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.
item.dc:creator: Ming Li

item.title: Bondi Beach Terror Suspects Condemned ‘Zionists’ and Amassed an Arsenal
item.description: Court documents reveal what police say were the movements and motivation of Sajid and Naveed Akram.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Fell, But Challenges Ahead
item.description: The narrower November deficit was largely due to an increase in revenues following the government’s decision to increase a tax on employment.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Bondi Beach Shooting Suspect Charged With Terrorism, Murder
item.description: Police charged 24-year-old Naveed Akram after he woke up from a coma.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Father and Son Used Licensed Firearms in Sydney Terror Attack, Police Say
item.description: The Australian prime minister said the suspects acted alone, as he called for tighter gun controls after the deadly Hanukkah shooting.

item.title: Terrorist Attack Targets Jews at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Killing 15
item.description: The suspects are a father, also killed, and his son, in the shooting at a Hanukkah event.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Putin and Modi Deepen Relationship That Has Drawn Trump’s Anger
item.description: The Russian president is embarking on a high-profile visit to India, aiming to protect a partnership that is a crucial for Moscow.

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.

item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
